bibl.title: Letter from Jesse William W. to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, May 15, 1890

div1.p: Lazear writes to his mother that he has finished packing.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse William W. to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, May 15, 1890
div1.p:
After seeing your train
pull out from Jersey City this evening,
I was inclined to be very gloomy.
But it occurred to me that
a better way to show affection would
be to be considerate and unselfish
when you are present rather than
to brood over parting. I know
that I have not been as
considerate and unselfish toward
you as I should have been.
In fact it seemed to me that
my going off on this trip was
a piece of selfishness. But
after thinking over the matter again
I think that the present plan
is best for each of us. It would
never do for me to keep you here
all summer, and it would not
do for me to go away where I
could not improve the time.
You will be more comfortable
where you are than any place
where I could be with you.
You must just take things easy
this summer. You must not put
yourself out about anything, nor
worry about anything. Just do
whatever you happen to feel inclined
to. “Eat whatever your appetite craves.”
And don't do anything you don't
feel like doing. If you don't
feel well send for Dr. Fleming or
some other good physician, and
don't take any advise from Dr. Fulton

And above all, don't
think of any imaginary dangers
to me. An ocean voyage is not
a dangerous undertaking at all.
In fact there is not near as
much danger in it as there is
in living in New York during
the summer months. The dangers
of an ocean trip are of rather
a spectacular sort, and are a
great deal more thought of than
they deserve, while we are
inclined to overlook the much
greater every-day dangers of living
in an unhealthy climate without
proper food and exercise.

I have just finished packing the
trunks and I think that at last
I have got everything in. Once I
thought I was through and closed
the trunks when I happened to
observe the two thermometers
hanging peacefully on the wall
I have engaged storage for the trunk
at the place on 22nd St. I will
send you the exact address to-
morrow. They charge 25 cts a month
for each trunk. I bought a
steamer trunk at Hearn's for about
a dollar & a half. It holds all
my things easily. I I will take
my wrapper and heavy shawl.

Your telegram arrived this
morning at 9:20, and I felt
very much relieved to know
that you got through the trip
safely.

I was just barely able to get
all the things into the three trunks,
I had no idea that there were so
many things.

Saturday morning -- Bright fine day. I am
just starting out to finish up what business
I have to attend to.
